items.summary: Former ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott is suing the bank for stripping him of $13.5 million in bonuses. Local stocks rallied on Friday after the Dow hit new records in a mixed session for Wall Street overnight.

items.title: Perth Scorchers into WBBL final as Beth Mooney continues sparkling form to down Sydney Sixers
items.summary: Sydney Sixers keeper Alyssa Healy misses a glorious chance to dismiss Beth Mooney, and the Aussie left-hander makes her pay big-time with a sparkling innings.

items.title: Police Commissioner Grant Stevens appointed to Adelaide Football Club board
items.summary: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

items.title: Australian rare earth processing plant to be ready for use in 2026

items.title: Why the football Dylan Brown showed for New Zealand can make his record-breaking move to Newcastle pay off
items.summary: The football Dylan Brown played for New Zealand should have won him the Golden Boot but it could also be the key to his record-breaking move to Newcastle.

items.title: How 'snakeheads' are redirecting illegal migration from China toward Australia
items.summary: Recent boat arrivals in Western Australia offer a glimpse into how routes through South-East Asia, particularly Indonesia, are being used to reach Australia.

items.title: Landlords eligible for $3,500 rebates for putting rooftop solar on rentals under Queensland scheme
items.summary: The $26 million pre-election commitment from the LNP is estimated by the government to save 6,500 households around $700 on energy bills, with applications opening on Friday morning.

items.title: Calls for vending machines in hospitals after women denied period products
items.summary: When Samantha Bruce got her period in hospital she wasn't able to get a pad or tampon. She says the response left her feeling "small and dehumanised".

items.title: Grieving families call for tougher penalties as NSW road toll surges
items.summary: Renee Ernst's world fell apart when her husband Troy was killed in a crash on his way home from work. She says consequences for dangerous driving need to be harsher.

items.title: Albanese's social media ban is bold reform, but it will take years to judge its real success
items.summary: Parents will thank the government for giving them more agency in dealing with the social media issue but kids aren't voters and it is hard to see the issue deciding votes either way.

items.title: Brisbane Racing Club under fire as members allege conflicts of interest and governance failures

items.summary: The finer details of a new NDIS planning system are yet to be finalised, but it's already drawing comparisons to failed Coalition-era reforms, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: NSW guidelines proposed to prevent hospitals from refusing abortion care based on personal beliefs
items.summary: Hospital managers and executives in NSW will be barred from blocking abortions because of moral and religious views, according to a document obtained by the ABC.

items.title: Amnesty International report finds Hamas committed crimes against humanity with October 7 attacks

items.title: Alleged co-owners of Goa nightclub Birch by Romeo Lane detained in Thailand following fire that killed 25 people

items.summary: Mark Rutte said Moscow could be ready to use military force against NATO in five years, adding Europe should be prepared for war comparable to what "our grandparents and great-grandparents endured".

items.summary: The Australian Olympic Committee hopes to keep more athletes in sport by offering cash incentives for women who return after having children, and tens of thousands of dollars for retiring Olympians.

items.title: Why WA's housing crisis is proving a roadblock to easing family and domestic violence
items.summary: The WA government is talking up its efforts to stamp out domestic and family violence, but there is one fundamental roadblock to alleviating the situation for women in crisis, and that is the state's housing crisis.

items.title: Tiwi Islands become 700,000-hectare Indigenous Protected Area under federal agreement
items.summary: The agreement with the federal government sees the Tiwi Islands included in Australia's national parks and reserves system.
